page.title: 07ANIMALS IN THE AREA
page.content: Cannis bouy further out to sea can be heard from the shore as it has a bell on it warning ships of the danger. {Gribbin Head-Farming-Animals ____________________________ On the Gribbin Headland there are very few animals.We saw Freisian and Guernsey cows.There were lots of sheep and we counted 73 in one field. {Gribbin Head-Wild Creatures ___________________________ We saw quite a variety of butterflies and insects.We identified the Common Brown and Cabbage White species. The wild birds we saw included some Moorhens and on the lake beside Polridmouth Beach there was a family of Mute Swans.
